page.title: 12Old Customs-Children's Games
page.content:
The arrival of the car demanded the roads to be improved. Tar was spread over the surface and chippings scattered over it. It was no longer possible to make rings for marbles nor squares for hop scotch. The loose chippings even made skipping more of a task than a pleasure.
Children looked forward to summer time when days were long and the weather always fine. Hours were spent away from home bathing in the river and cooking trout on the log fire. Sometimes the children would go to farms to help on the hay as there were always free rides on the empty "gambo" on its way back to the field, and in the night a free supper for minding the horses whilst the "gambos" were being loaded.
